title: LoL on a laptop with Nvidia's new mobile GPU's (960m/970m/980m)
body:
Hey guys,

As title suggests I'm looking at a laptop to run LoL while I'm away from my desktops (for about 3 months of the year)
I can spend up to 2.5k but that would be going all out and getting top end CPU and usually a 980m GPU but if i can i would like to save some money and spend a little less.

My question is really towards those that are using laptops running these GPU's and their experience Im assuming the 980m being the top of the range mobile GPU it should perform ok but would like to know how the 960m and the 970m preform at max settings, can they run LoL at 60FPS with no FPS drop in team fights ect.

Also will LoL push the CPU as most gaming laptops in my price range have the i7-4710HQ and 4720HQ's CPU's and they seem to be the standard

all i seem to find while googling and searching other forums is "should be ok" and "Don't know but refer to minimum specs" doesn't really give me any real specific information.

So yeah if you know first hand how these GPUs run LoL can you let me know.

Cheers

Daisuke/Xnifed

Can't find the article ill keep looking, but the gist was

Open Nvidia Control Panel>manage 3D settings> make sure LoL is on the program list to use the Nvidia card if not add.

Also limit your FPS to cap at 60 FPS, Trust me unless your on a 4k monitor your not "seeing" 200 FPS your screen cant display that even if its a 120hz monitor it doesn't technically display at 120 Hz its still only 60 but Predicts the image to appear to be 120hz

Also Play in Boarderless Window Mode this will make sure the nVidia card is being used i had to do this on my Beastly SLI'd desktop.

And ensure you are using the most up to date Drivers, if your using Beta Drivers revert to most current non Beta Drivers

You can Also access most of the options in the Nvidia GeForce Expireince Tab ensuring that League is on the list and let the program decide what the best setting for the game are based on your setup

Hope one of these helps
